intro: Cicerbita variabilis, commonly known as the variable celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, aggregate fruits that contain several seeds. Cicerbita variabilis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
